children.text: There are gaps around the external window frame that needs to be sealed to prevent water and pest ingress.
The Victorian Building Authority’s Guide to Standards and Tolerances clause 8.02 Weather-tightness of windows, doors, and window and door frames states that

‘Window frame and door frame installations are defective if, due to the builder’s workmanship, they leak or cause unhealthy or dangerous conditions, loss of amenity for occupants, undue dampness or deterioration of building elements’ .
These gaps must be sealed in accordance with the above requirement to avoid water that may leak, or pest ingress that may cause unhealthy conditions or damage the building elements.
